132.title: A cloud home which appears to hover over the fi...

1321.content:
“Uh... can I help you?”
She shoots you a quizzical glare.

“Sorry, I’m new here. Just looking around. Is this your house?”

“Mhm! Pretty cool, huh?” She gloats, though her voice is distant and somewhat quiet.
“Hey, Uh, you wanna come up here? I can’t exactly hear you so well.”

“I’m not sure I can.” You grin.

“Hold up. Uh... Twilight gave me some potion doohickey... somewhere...”

She disappears for a few moments, and soon returns, holding a little plastic tube between her teeth.

“Dwilighh said... thish willhh lehh youhh shtand on cloudsh..”
she spits it out, sending it hurtling down towards you, and you manage to catch it.

“Yeah, if you drink that, then clouds should support you for 24 hours - I mean, I sure hope so or else...” she laughs wryly and then softly uses her wings to descend down to ground level.

You can see the Pegasus more clearly now; she has a rainbow mane and tail, with a small cloud discharging a bolt of multicolored lighting as a cutie mark.

You tilt your head back, drinking down the contents of the tube. It’s slightly minty, but has no immediate effect you can feel.

“Yeah... I’m gonna have to lift you up there.” She says suddenly, levitating over behind you and scooping you up by locking her arms under yours.

You feel yourself being lifted above the ground. It’s a little scary at first, but she has you pretty tightly.

You’re placed down onto the clouds, feeling your feet settle against the surface, that quick second of fear soon fading.

“I really need to get some stairs or something.” She says to herself, letting you go and trotting around in front of you again.

“I’m Rainbow Dash, by the way!” She holds a hoof to her chest and spreads her wings proudly, as if you’re supposed to already know who she is, but you don’t.

“Hi! I’m Peppermint Swirl.”

“New here, huh? What brings you to Ponyville?”

“Well, I’m actually here to work for Twilight... I guess you two know each other if she made that potion for you.”

“Wait... work for her? How?”

“Like, an assistant. I think.”

She shakes her head and scoffs incredulously.
“As if Twilight needs another assistant! That’s so unfair! She’s already got, like, three! Oh, this is so like her! If there’s anyone who needs an assistant, it’s me!”

“You do?”

“Yeah! I’m a wonderbolt, you know. I don’t have anypony to wash my clothes or help me prepare, and she’s got Spike and Starlight to help her!”

She’s still shaking her head.

“Why can’t you be my assistant, instead? How much is she paying you?”

“Well, it’s more of an expenses paid sort of thing, but I’ve already told Twilight I’ll be working for her..”

“So tell her you changed your mind! I’m the one who deserves the assistant here! I’m sure you’d rather work for me than being stuck in some stuffy library all day! C’mon!”

“Well, I’m just not sure..”

She pauses, and a devious smile crawls across her face.

“Well, the way I see it, you don’t have any way of getting down from here without my help. You’re not really in a position to say no, are you?”

“...what?”

“All I’m asking is you be my assistant for... one day. Until your potion wears off, at least, and if you like it better, you work for me instead! Though... I’m also the one with the potions keeping you up here, so I would choose something in my interest, if I were you..”

Jeez. She’s crazy! Though you have a loyalty to Twilight, you can’t exactly argue with Rainbow Dash, and your induction isn’t technically until tomorrow, anyway, so there’s no harm in humoring her for just one day. Hopefully her threats are as empty and desperate as they seem.

“I guess for one day...”

“Great! Sorry if I seemed a little... Uh... threatening, it’s just that I’ve been needing an assistant for ages now, and it’s just not fair for Twilight to hog you like that!”

Rainbow Dash leads you towards the entrance of her house. She seems okay, though her threat is still looming over you.

“Well, here’s my crib. I know, I know, it’s pretty awesome. No need to tell me.” She chuckles to herself.

You’re both in a large hallway, with a staircase leading up to the next floor, and doorways to your left and right.

“I would give you the tour, but you’ll see the whole place while you’re working for me. My bedroom’s upstairs, kitchen and lounge are down here, I’ve got a little training ground out back, and the bathroom’s upstairs too.” She looks back at you. “If you do decide to take up the position, you can take the spare room. I haven’t exactly got a bed in there, but there’s a mattress.... I think.” She briefly flashes you a wide smile.

“But anyway, the first order of business....”
1321.title: A cyan Pegasus peeks her head over

choices: “I’ve got a blocked toilet that needs cleaning!”
13211.content:
“You want me to what!?”

“Clean my laundry! That’s what assistants do, right? It’s been sitting there for like week, and I’m wayy too busy to do it myself!”

“Fine.” You grumble.

“It gets pretty sweaty in all that wonderbolt gear!” She jeers, as if this is all giving her some kind of sick satisfaction.

Rainbow Dash shows you to the laundry room, just past the kitchen, where a large, nearly overflowing bundle of clothes sit in a basket and produce an immediately apparent smell of damp sweat.

“You just gotta separate the colors from the whites, then wash them both individually. Not too hard, huh? If you were with Twilight right now she’d probably be using you as a victim for some weird spell, or making you mark her student’s homework or something!”

She leaves you to it, trotting away casually to no doubt go and laze around on her flanks.

You kneel down beside the pile of laundry, wishing you had a clothes peg as you start to take out the items of clothing and place them in the appropriate baskets.

The disgustingly damp smell only gets worse as you start to take pieces of clothing out; it’s like the smell of a dirty old mop.

The clothes themselves feel filthy, too. They’re soaked in perspiration - just how sweaty does this Pegasus get!?

You pull out a blue full body wonderbolt suit with Rainbow Dash’s cutie mark printed on the side, and it smells the worst of them all.

You swear you almost see sweat dripping from the outfit, a buildup collected through all her long, exhausting flights and training. You don’t even want to imagine how much time she’s spent in this suit, and how infrequently she’s washed it.

You throw it into the color basket, and Rainbow Dash returns in the doorway.

“You’re getting through this pretty fast. What’s wrong? That’s the smell of success, you know!”

Unexpectedly she comes up behind you, using her hoof to force your head down into the basket, your face brushing up against the soggy unwashed clothing, the piercing scent of her musky sweat penetrating your nostrils full force.

You try to push your way out, but she’s too strong. All that training seems to have paid off.

“You know what? It seems to me like you’re not being very respectful. You don’t even know who I am, Do you? I bet if you were doing Twilight’s laundry, you wouldn’t be acting like it was such a chore!”
She pauses, her hoof still pushing your head down and digging into the back of your neck.

“I want you to show me a little respect for once. I want you to realise who you’re working for, so lick it.”

“Lick... what?”

“Celestia, the laundry! Lick it!”

You couldn’t possibly. The smell alone is enough to make you gag.

“My wonderbolt suit. I want you to take it back out and lick it.”

You pause again. It doesn’t look like you have a chance, but if you can put it off for even another minute you want to.

“Come on! You want to go visit your precious Princess Twilight Sparkle, right? That’s your ticket out.”

Meekly you reach into the color basket, and pull out the damp onepiece, the smell still radiating from it strongly.

“C’mon! It tastes like candy, I promise!” She chuckles.

You begin to lick it, feeling the sweat squeeze out onto your tongue with the bitter flavor of Dash’s bodily perfume.
You retch, pretty loudly, and bring yourself to lick it again.

“Good, huh?” She sneers, her voice sharp and pitiless.
“You wanna guess how many times I’ve farted in that thing?” She laughs again, partly at your misfortune and partly at her own repulsive attitude.

“Okay, that’s enough. Now it’s time to lick the real thing.”

Confused, you turn your head, and find yourself face-to-cheek with her rump, her tail swishing from side to side.

“Lick my cheeks. I was working out earlier, so I’m sure there’s plenty of fresh perspiration on them!”

You exhale sharply, noticing the smell coming from her rear end is even worse than the smell coming from the laundry.

“Oh, and before you showed up I took a pretty big dump, so apologies if it’s extra stinky back there!”

This mare is disgusting. When you thought about Ponyville hospitality, you certainly didn’t think of this.

You extend your tongue, closing your eyes and licking. It’s warm and clammy; the distinctive musky smell that was on the clothes is even stronger coming from the source itself.

“Now the other one. I’m feeling cleaner already, I can see why Twilight wanted an assistant.”

You lick the other cheek, gagging at the little beads of sweat which seem to stick to your tongue.

“Okay. That’s enough for now. Don’t even think you’re worth a taste of what’s between them.” She snickers and steps away from you.

You feel as low as you possibly can, on your knees and shaking on the floor, with the taste of sweat clinging to your tongue and refusing to let go.

“Anyway...”
13211.title: Wash my dirty laundry!

132111.content:
“What!?”

“You heard me. If you’re going to be my assistant, you’re gonna have to get used to doing what I say.”

You never even wanted to be her assistant in the first place, but once again you’re left with no choice. She’s already demonstrated how much power she can exert over you if she wants. She definitely stronger and more agile than you’ll ever be, so refusing is simply fruitless.

“Fine.”

“Hey!” She delivers a swift kick to your side, sending you toppling over onto the floor.
“That didn’t sound very enthusiastic now, did it? Try it again, and this time how about you address me as Ms. Dash.”

You look up to see the twisted sadistic smile fixed on her face. This mare is completely insane. She’s probably been waiting for some innocuous, oblivious stranger to come by just so she could snare them in her trap.

“Please show me to the bathroom, Ms. Dash.” You feel the last slither of dignity leave you as you get back up, and she leads you out and up the stairs.

Her bathroom is surprisingly pristine; fitted with a sizable shower, a little water feature and of course the toilet.

You approach it with her, peering down into the bowl and seeing the bundle of soiled paper and brown waste blocking it, so much so that it’s even above the water level.

“Yeah. Pretty impressive, huh? Took a long time to squeeze out but I’d say that’s one for the photo album!”
Really, you can’t tell if she’s joking or telling the truth. Neither would surprise you.

It’s best to just get this job out of the way. It’s going to need to be done sooner or later.

Something’s not right, though. You look around again to double check you didn’t miss it.

“Uh... Ms. Dash? There’s no plunger.”

“Well of course there isn’t. You think I’m gonna waste money on something like that?”

Judging by the needless addition of a water feature in her bathroom, you wouldn’t think a plunger would be too far out her budget.

“Then... how am I supposed to unblock it?”

She smirks. “Guess you’ll have to work something out by yourself.”

“Anyway. Me and Soarin gotta practice for my big race this weekend, so I’ll be back later. It better be clean by then.”
With this, she slams the door behind her and leaves.

Dammit. What are you supposed to do? The idea runs through your mind that you could make some hasty escape while she’s out, but there’s no way you could see that happening without breaking your legs from the fall, and even if there was, she probably would have thought of that.

You desperately search the bathroom for something you can use to unclog the profane mess she’s left in the toilet; a stick, something to scoop it up with - but there’s nothing you can use.

You could always go and grab something from the kitchen and use that, but she probably wouldn’t be happy when she found out, and you could bet she would.

After exhausting every other option in your head, it becomes clear you have only two options..
132111.title: “I’ve got a blocked toilet that needs clean...

1321111.content:
You intake a short, tense breath, and using every ounce of will you have march back over to the toilet bowl. It's clear that Rainbow Dash has orchestrated this situation so that you're left with no other choice than to unclog the toilet manually. Even with your own waste you wouldn't do something like this in a million years, but knowing her the alternative would only be a hundred times worse.

It's hard to not try to delay the deed itself any more, and you stare for a few seconds at the thick clumpy excrement down in the toilet water.

"Forgive me, Celestia..." You tell yourself, biting your lip and then submerging one hoof down into the toilet water.

The muscles in your face begin to tense up even more as you feel the texture of the dung against your hoof; it's like thick, gritty mud that's accumulated into one big pile under the water. It feels like it's blocked all the way down to the pipe, but you continue to push it out the way, trying desperately to clear a passage and let it all flush away. It's obvious this will take more than a single flush to clear, though.

The smell is also beginning to become overwhelming. It's a horribly earthy stench that reminds you of the unpleasant odor of a public bathroom.

After a few more seconds of digging and burrowing down into the mass of fecal matter, you finally feel your hoof break through to the other side and find the pipe which seems to twist up sharply.

You retrieve your hoof back out from the toilet, now stained brown, and pump the lever to flush as hard as you can.

The toilet lets out a watery hissing sound as it tries its best to rid itself of its contents, and, to your relief, does manage to flush about half of the shit-infused toilet water down the pipe, but not all of it.

After letting the water refill, you give it another flush, feeling yourself elate slightly at the sight of the last of Rainbow's disgusting waste flushed away and out of sight.

That's the toilet unblocked, but there's still another glaring problem to solve; your shit-caked arm. The smell is starting to heighten now it's out of the water, and you're not totally sure how you can even get rid of a stench like this. Like garlic, you'll probably still be sensing a hint of it on your hoof a week from now.

She glances down at the notes on her desk. You see that she'd been grading assignments from her students, some of which had been marked in red. Looking back up, she gives you an anxious look. "Say, you wouldn't mind helping me with something, would you?"

You give her a quizzical look. "What do you need?"

"Well..." She takes a breath, nudging herself to continue. "It's just, I have these papers I need to grade, and my, err... emissions are sort of distracting, so I may need you to help, ehem... muffle them."
1352.title: Call out and say hello

13521.content:
"You will? Oh thank goodness. You're a lifesaver."

"What do you need me to do?" you ask.

"Uh, well... What I need is something that'll help to muffle the sound, and probably the smell, while I work on grading the rest of the assignments." She gives you a nervous glance.

"And what exactly did you have in mind?"

Cheerilee shuffles hesitantly before pointing her hoof. "You..."
Getting up, she motions you over to her side of the desk. "Unfortunately, there isn't anything here that I can adequately use, so I was sort of hoping your face could, y'know... I-If that's alright with you, of course."

She smiles, but you see the blush on her face getting redder as she tries to explain. You can tell it must have taken a lot of willpower for her to even consider asking this.

"Whenever you're ready." She gestures to the stool behind her desk.

You oblige and get into yourself into position. Sitting down with your body underneath the desk, you lay your head face up on the wooden stool. As you try to get comfortable, the sight of Cheerilee's magenta cheeks soon eclipses your vision.

She glances over her shoulder, giving you a nervous look before she takes her seat, gently lowering her rump down onto your face. Your muzzle slips in between her cheeks as she gets settled. Her dock rests against your forehead as her tail is draped over your head. She shuffles herself a bit, wiggling her rear, and you feel your nose being shoved up against her anus.

You can still smell traces of her earlier gaseous release, the faint stench leaking into your nostrils. It wasn't an entirely pleasant smell, but you had already agreed to help her with this, so you didn't complain.

You hear Cheerilee start to work, marking down the assignments on her desk. Before long, she winces as her stomach emits a low ominous gurgle. She tenses up, leaning a bit to the side and giving you a fraction of a second of fresh air before her anus flares, and a somewhat loud, raspy fart erupts.

The sound is indeed muffled, vibrating against your cheeks as it bellows out. Not a second later are you assaulted with the smell, the scent of what seemed like half-digested hay and nuts filling your nostrils. Whatever she had for lunch was definitely not agreeing with her, the results of which were wreaking havoc on both of you.

"Oh my..." You hear Cheerilee gasp before she strains herself again, and another more drawn-out fart is released. You feel it slip out roughly against your cheeks, same as the last one, the ensuing smell occupying the small space between your nose and her anus. "Heh... Excuse me. I didn't expect my lunch to be this bad. I hope it isn't too bad down there."

She sounded genuinely worried, so it was nice to know that she was keeping aware for your well-being. "I've already gotten through most of the assignments, so the rest shouldn't take too long. Just... try not to pass out on me, alright?"

As you are left to deal with the vestigial emissions, Cheerilee turns her attention back to the assignments on her desk. A few minutes pass before she shifts herself again, lifting a cheek off your face as a short, windy blast of hot gas shoots from her tailhole. Your nose scrunches, the rotten stench washing over your face. Cheerilee readjusts her position, her cheeks wrapping perfectly around your face and trapping you in a stinky hotbox.

The rest of your session continues on; Cheerilee manages to eke out another fart which you dutifully inhale, your eyes watering with each sniff you took. The smell obviously wasn't getting any better, but you try to make due, nonetheless.

It isn't long after Cheerilee lifts herself up, her rump rising off your face and allowing you to breathe some fresh air. She glances down, giving you a sympathetic smile, and helps you to your hooves.

"Are you okay?" she asks. You nod, and your attention turns to her desk. All of her students' papers were graded, set aside in a neat little stack. "Everything's done, but I think there's still one more I need to let go."

You had a pretty good idea of what she was alluding to as she points bashfully to her rump. Turning around, she leans on her desk as you kneel behind her, pressing your nose against her anus. She grunts, and you are once more blasted with a loud, sputtery fart, the sound muffled as you press your face against her butt.

"Oh, wow..." Cheerilee fans her hoof in front of her muzzle, a faint blush on her cheeks. She turns around as you stand back up. "Thanks for your help, Peppermint. I really appreciate it."

"No problem. Happy to help." It certainly wasn't something you expected to help with, but she was grateful all the same.

As you make your way towards the exit, Cheerilee calls out to you.

"Say, you wouldn't mind sticking around a little longer, would you?" she asks.

"What do you mean?"

"I know you're busy with Twilight, being her assistant and all, but I was wondering if you'd like to help around at the school once in a while. I could always use a teacher's aide and your... performance really convinced me. It's all up to you, of course."
13521.title: You agree
